SP-CRITAN.name: Ammonium Nitrate
SP-CRITAN.description: Related to registration information of those who own and operate ammonium nitrate facilities, purchasers of ammonium nitrate, and the regulation of sales and transfers of ammonium nitrate.

CVI.name: Chemical-terrorism Vulnerability Information
CVI.description: In accordance with Section 550(c) of the Department of Homeland Security Appropriations Act of 2007, the following information, whether transmitted verbally, electronically, or in written form, shall constitute CVI, see (1) - (9).

SP-CVI.name: Chemical-terrorism Vulnerability Information
SP-CVI.description: In accordance with Section 550(c) of the Department of Homeland Security Appropriations Act of 2007, the following information, whether transmitted verbally, electronically, or in written form, shall constitute CVI, see (1) - (9).

SP-CEII.name: Critical Energy Infrastructure Information
SP-CEII.description: Critical energy infrastructure information means specific engineering, vulnerability, or detailed design information about proposed or existing critical infrastructure that: (i) Relates details about the production, generation, transportation, transmission, or distribution of energy; (ii) Could be useful to a person in planning an attack on critical infrastructure;... and (iii) Does not simply give the general location of the critical infrastructure.

EMGT.name: Emergency Management
EMGT.description: Related to information concerning the continuity of executive branch operations during all-hazards emergencies or other situations that may disrupt normal operations.

CRIT.name: General Critical Infrastructure Information
CRIT.description: Systems and assets, whether physical or virtual, so vital that the incapacity or destruction of such may have a debilitating impact on the security, economy, public health or safety, environment, or any combination of these matters, across any Federal, State, regional, territorial, or local jurisdiction.

ISVI.name: Information Systems Vulnerability Information
ISVI.description: Related to information that if not protected, could result in adverse effects to information systems. Information system means a discrete set of information resources organized for the collection, processing, maintenance, use, sharing, dissemination, or disposition of information.

PHYS.name: Physical Security
PHYS.description: Related to protection of federal buildings, grounds or property.

SP-PCII.name: Protected Critical Infrastructure Information
SP-PCII.description: As defined by 6 USC 131-134, and 6 CFR 29, PCII relates to threats, vulnerabilities, or operational experience related to the national infrastructure. PCII offers protection to private sector infrastructure information voluntarily shared with government entities for purposes of homeland security.

SAFE.name: SAFETY Act Information
SAFE.description: Defined as "SAFETY Act Confidential Information" in 6 CFR Part 25, the regulations implementing the Support Anti-terrorism by Fostering Effective Technologies Act of 2002, SAFETY Act Information includes any and all information and data voluntarily submitted to the Department of Homeland Security under this part, including inventions, devices, Technology, know-how, designs, copyrighted information, trade secrets, confidential business information, analyses, test and evaluation results, and other materials.

SP-TSCA.name: Toxic Substances
SP-TSCA.description: Health, safety, and exposure information related to chemical substances, chemical mixtures, and articles as defined under the Toxic Substances Control Act (TSCA).

WATER.name: Water Assessments
WATER.description: Vulnerability Assessments on the risks and security of public drinking water systems, to include, but not be limited to, a review of pipes and constructed conveyances, physical barriers, water collection, pretreatment, treatment, storage and distribution facilities, electronic, computer or other automated systems which are utilized by the public water system, the use, storage, or handling of various chemicals, and the operation and maintenance of such system.

SP-CTI.name: Controlled Technical Information
SP-CTI.description: Controlled Technical Information means technical information with military or space application that is subject to controls on the access, use, reproduction, modification, performance, display, release, disclosure, or dissemination. This includes technical data or computer software as defined in Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement clause 252.227-7013.

DCRIT.name: DoD Critical Infrastructure Security Information
DCRIT.description: Information that, if disclosed, would reveal vulnerabilities in the DoD critical infrastructure and, if exploited, would likely result in the significant disruption, destruction, or damage of or to DoD operations, property, or facilities, including information regarding the securing and safeguarding of explosives, hazardous chemicals, or pipelines, related to critical infrastructure or protected systems owned or operated on behalf of the DoD.

NNPI.name: Naval Nuclear Propulsion Information
NNPI.description: Related to the safety of reactors and associated naval nuclear propulsion plants, and control of radiation and radioactivity associated with naval nuclear propulsion activities, including prescribing and enforcing standards and regulations for these areas as they affect the environment and the safety and health of workers, operators, and the general public.

SP-NNPI.name: Naval Nuclear Propulsion Information
SP-NNPI.description: Related to the safety of reactors and associated naval nuclear propulsion plants, and control of radiation and radioactivity associated with naval nuclear propulsion activities, including prescribing and enforcing standards and regulations for these areas as they affect the environment and the safety and health of workers, operators, and the general public.

PSI.name: Privileged Safety Information
PSI.description: PSI is information reflective of a deliberative process in the safety investigation or given to a safety investigator pursuant to a promise of confidentiality, which the safety privilege protects from being released outside safety channels or from being used for any purpose except mishap prevention.

DCNI.name: Unclassified Controlled Nuclear Information - Defense
DCNI.description: Relating to Department of Defense special nuclear material (SNM), equipment, and facilities, as defined by 32 CFR 223.

SP-DCNI.name: Unclassified Controlled Nuclear Information - Defense
SP-DCNI.description: Relating to Department of Defense special nuclear material (SNM), equipment, and facilities, as defined by 32 CFR 223.

EXPT.name: Export Controlled
EXPT.description: Unclassified information concerning certain items, commodities, technology, software, or other information whose export could reasonably be expected to adversely affect the United States national security and nonproliferation objectives. To include dual use items; items identified in export administration regulations, international traffic in arms regulations (ITAR) and the munitions list; license applications; and sensitive nuclear technology information.

SP-EXPT.name: Export Controlled
SP-EXPT.description: Unclassified information concerning certain items, commodities, technology, software, or other information whose export could reasonably be expected to adversely affect the United States national security and nonproliferation objectives. To include dual use items; items identified in export administration regulations, international traffic in arms regulations (ITAR) and the munitions list; license applications; and sensitive nuclear technology information.

EXPTR.name: Export Controlled Research
EXPTR.description: Related to the systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources in order to establish facts and reach new conclusions.

FSEC.name: Bank Secrecy
FSEC.description: Information that is provided to the government pursuant to the Bank Secrecy Act, including but not limited to, suspicious activity reports (SAR), currency transaction reports (CTR), reports of international transportation of currency or monetary instruments (CMIR), reports of cash payment over $10,000 received in trade or business, and reports of foreign bank and financial accounts (FBAR).

SP-FSEC.name: Bank Secrecy
SP-FSEC.description: Information that is provided to the government pursuant to the Bank Secrecy Act, including but not limited to, suspicious activity reports (SAR), currency transaction reports (CTR), reports of international transportation of currency or monetary instruments (CMIR), reports of cash payment over $10,000 received in trade or business, and reports of foreign bank and financial accounts (FBAR).

SP-BUDG.name: Budget
SP-BUDG.description: Related to information concerning the federal budget, including authorizations and estimates of income and expenditures.

COMPT.name: Comptroller General
COMPT.description: Concerning the Officer of the United States Government who is charged with duties relating to fiscal affairs, including auditing, examining accounts, and reporting the financial status of the United States Government.

SP-CCI.name: Consumer Complaint Information
SP-CCI.description: Related to information concerning consumer complaints or inquiries concerning financial institutions or consumer financial products and services, and responses to them.

XFER.name: Electronic Funds Transfer
XFER.description: Relating to the computer-based systems used to perform financial transactions electronically.

FHFANPI.name: Federal Housing Finance Non-Public Information
FHFANPI.description: Related to information that the Federal Housing Finance Agency (FHFA) has not made public that is created by, obtained by, or communicated to an FHFA employee in connection with the performance of official duties, regardless of who is in possession of the information, including confidential supervisory information.

FSI.name: Financial Supervision Information
FSI.description: Related to information connected to an agency's responsibilities to supervise, examine, and evaluate a financial institution.

FNC.name: General Financial Information
FNC.description: Related to the duties, transactions, or otherwise falling under the purview of financial institutions or United States Government fiscal functions. Uses may include, but are not limited to, customer information held by a financial institution.

SP-FNC.name: General Financial Information
SP-FNC.description: Related to the duties, transactions, or otherwise falling under the purview of financial institutions or United States Government fiscal functions. Uses may include, but are not limited to, customer information held by a financial institution.

FINT.name: International Financial Institutions
FINT.description: Relating to entities that provide financial services for its clients or members, and were established (or chartered) by more than one country, and hence are subjects of international law.

MERG.name: Mergers
MERG.description: Relating to methods by which corporations legally unify ownership of assets formerly subject to separate controls.

NETW.name: Net Worth
NETW.description: Related to the net worth of an individual and/or their affiliates in certain administrative proceedings.

RTR.name: Retirement
RTR.description: Related to post-employment funding provided by an employer.

ASYL.name: Asylee
ASYL.description: Related to refugee applications and associated hearings to grant asylum to foreign nationals in the United States to be recognized as asylees.

BATT.name: Battered Spouse or Child
BATT.description: Related to information within applications and associated hearings provided by, or that could identify, a battered spouse or child of a US citizen or US permanent resident seeking independent protected status within the United States.

RESD.name: Permanent Resident Status
RESD.description: Related to applications and associated hearings to grant permanent residency to foreign nationals living in the United States.

ADJ.name: Status Adjustment
ADJ.description: Related to applications for the adjustment of immigration status.

PROT.name: Temporary Protected Status
PROT.description: Related to findings that conditions in a given country pose a danger to personal safety due to ongoing armed conflict or an environmental disaster and persons should receive special temporary status to remain in the United States.

IVIC.name: Victims of Human Trafficking
IVIC.description: Related to identifiable information of persons who have been victims of human trafficking and their family members.

VISA.name: Visas
VISA.description: Related to applications or permits to enter the United States.

AG.name: Agriculture
AG.description: Information related to the agricultural operation, farming or conservation practices, or the actual land of an agricultural producer or landowner.

SP-FISA.name: Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act
SP-FISA.description: Related to unclassified and declassified information that is collected from unconsenting individuals under the authority of the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act (FISA).

SP-FISAB.name: Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act Business Records
SP-FISAB.description: Related to books, records, papers, documents, and other items produced for an investigation to obtain foreign intelligence information.

INTEL.name: General Intelligence
INTEL.description: Related to intelligence activities, sources, or methods.

SP-INTEL.name: General Intelligence
SP-INTEL.description: Related to intelligence activities, sources, or methods.

SP-GEO.name: Geodetic Product Information
SP-GEO.description: Related to imagery, imagery intelligence, or geospatial information.

SP-IFNC.name: Intelligence Financial Records
SP-IFNC.description: Related to financial records obtained for intelligence or counterintelligence activity, investigation, or analysis.

ID.name: Internal Data
ID.description: Refers to a category of information that is not intended to be disseminated beyond CIA channels that involves intelligence activities, sources, or methods. This information may also relate to the CIA's organization, functions, names, official titles, salaries, or numbers of personnel.

SP-ID.name: Internal Data
SP-ID.description: Refers to a category of information that is not intended to be disseminated beyond CIA channels that involves intelligence activities, sources, or methods. This information may also relate to the CIA's organization, functions, names, official titles, salaries, or numbers of personnel.

OPSEC-INTEL.name: Operations Security
OPSEC-INTEL.description: Critical information determined to give evidence of the planning and execution of sensitive (frequently classified) government activities after going through a formal systematic vetting process in accordance with National Security Presidential Memorandum Number 28. This process identifies unclassified information that must be protected. It almost always results from an agency's official OPSEC program, or is otherwise commonly approved for use by the CUI Senior Agency Official.

SP-INTL.name: International Agreement Information
SP-INTL.description: Information provided by, otherwise made available by, or produced in cooperation with, a foreign government or international organization that requires protection pursuant to an existing treaty, agreement, bilateral exchange or other obligation under the requirements stipulated in 10 USC 130c(b), when not subject to classification under Executive Order 13526. Title 10 USC 130c(b) may exempt this class of foreign government information from the safeguard provisions otherwise required by Executive Order 13526.

SP-AIV.name: Accident Investigation
SP-AIV.description: Related to information obtained during the course of an accident or incident investigation. Including but not limited to information related to wreckage, records, mail, or cargo.

SP-FUND.name: Campaign Funds
SP-FUND.description: Related to information obtained in connection to an investigation into campaign finance and disclosure laws. Usage may include but is not limited to notification or investigation pertaining to financial support of a candidate for election.

CMPRS.name: Committed Person
CMPRS.description: Related to information concerning the mental condition of a person committed to a psychiatric facility.

LCOMM.name: Communications
LCOMM.description: Related to the contents of any wire, oral, or electronic communication.

SP-SUB.name: Controlled Substances
SP-SUB.description: Information obtained by the Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) or in DEA investigative reports related to controlled substances.

SP-CHRI.name: Criminal History Records Information
SP-CHRI.description: Related to information collected by criminal justice agencies on individuals consisting of identifiable descriptions and notations of arrests, detentions, indictments, informations, or other formal criminal charges, and any disposition arising therefrom, including acquittal, sentencing, correctional supervision, and release.

SP-LDNA.name: DNA
SP-LDNA.description: Related to hereditary material in humans that is used for law enforcement purposes.

LEI.name: General Law Enforcement
LEI.description: Related to techniques and procedures for law enforcement operations, investigations, prosecutions, or enforcement actions.

INF.name: Informant
INF.description: Related to the identity of a human source.

SP-INF.name: Informant
SP-INF.description: Related to the identity of a human source.

INV.name: Investigation
INV.description: Related to information obtained during the course of a law enforcement investigation or action, civil or criminal.

SP-INV.name: Investigation
SP-INV.description: Related to information obtained during the course of a law enforcement investigation or action, civil or criminal.

JUV.name: Juvenile
JUV.description: Related to the identity of individual juvenile youths.

SP-LFNC.name: Law Enforcement Financial Records
SP-LFNC.description: Related to financial records obtained for law enforcement purposes.

LNSL.name: National Security Letter
LNSL.description: Related to administrative orders sent to compel the recipients of the letters to provide information to federal investigators.

TRACE.name: Pen Register/Trap & Trace
TRACE.description: Related to devices used to identify incoming and outgoing telephone numbers.

RWRD.name: Reward
RWRD.description: Related to the identity of a recipient of a reward.

SCV.name: Sex Crime Victim
SCV.description: Related to the identity of a victim of a sex offense.

LSCRN.name: Terrorist Screening
LSCRN.description: Related to information gathering and analysis concerning possible threats or acts of a destructive nature.

WHSTL.name: Whistleblower Identity
WHSTL.description: Identity of anyone providing information relating to a legal violation or illicit or unsafe activity, including information provided by a whistleblower which could reasonably be expected to reveal the identity of a whistleblower.

SP-WHSTL.name: Whistleblower Identity
SP-WHSTL.description: Identity of anyone providing information relating to a legal violation or illicit or unsafe activity, including information provided by a whistleblower which could reasonably be expected to reveal the identity of a whistleblower.

ADPO.name: Administrative Proceedings
ADPO.description: Adjudication of agency-related matters including, but not limited to, dispute resolution, settlements, and issuances of orders.

SP-ADPO.name: Administrative Proceedings
SP-ADPO.description: Adjudication of agency-related matters including, but not limited to, dispute resolution, settlements, and issuances of orders.

SP-CHLD.name: Child Pornography
SP-CHLD.description: From 18 USC 2256(8) "child pornography" means any visual depiction, including any photograph, film, video, picture, or computer or computer-generated image or picture, whether made or produced by electronic, mechanical, or other means, of sexually explicit conduct, where— (A) the production of such visual depiction involves the use of a minor engaging in sexually explicit conduct; (B) such visual depiction is a digital image, computer image, or computer-generated image that is, or is indistinguishable from, that of a minor engaging in sexually explicit conduct; or (C) such visual depiction has been created, adapted, or modified to appear that an identifiable minor is engaging in sexually explicit conduct

CVIC.name: Child Victim/Witness
CVIC.description: Information pertaining to a minor who was a victim, witness, or potential witness to a criminal act.

BARG.name: Collective Bargaining
BARG.description: Defining agencies' and representatives' duty to negotiate in good faith to include disclosure of certain labor relations training and guidance materials and limiting the issuance of certain subpoenas.

JURY.name: Federal Grand Jury
JURY.description: Material obtained pursuant to a federal grand jury subpoena, which includes (1) any reference to a specific sitting grand jury; (2) any documentation or data obtained by a grand jury subpoena if disclosure of such material tends to reveal what transpired before or at the direction of the federal grand jury; (3) documentation prepared specifically for the federal grand jury; and (4) transcripts or other recordings of testimony presented to the federal grand jury.

SP-JURY.name: Federal Grand Jury
SP-JURY.description: Material obtained pursuant to a federal grand jury subpoena, which includes (1) any reference to a specific sitting grand jury; (2) any documentation or data obtained by a grand jury subpoena if disclosure of such material tends to reveal what transpired before or at the direction of the federal grand jury; (3) documentation prepared specifically for the federal grand jury; and (4) transcripts or other recordings of testimony presented to the federal grand jury.

PRIVILEGE.name: Legal Privilege
PRIVILEGE.description: Per 15 USC 78x(f)(4): The term "privilege" includes any work-product privilege, attorney-client privilege, governmental privilege, or other privilege recognized under Federal, State, or foreign law. Per 502(g): (1) "attorney-client privilege" means the protection that applicable law provides for confidential attorney-client communications, and (2) "work-product protection" means the protection that applicable law provides for tangible material (or its intangible equivalent) prepared in anticipation of litigation or for trial.

LMI.name: Legislative Materials
LMI.description: Data related to Congress's legislative, investigatory or oversight responsibilities of the Executive branch of the Federal government. This includes data related to proposed or pending legislation as well as inquiries submitted by Congress to Federal agencies, agency responses to those inquiries and any other information which, if disclosed, would reveal the nature and scope of Congressional inquiries.

PRE.name: Presentence Report
PRE.description: A report, generally prepared to assist the court in determining the most appropriate sentence for a defendant. It can include an assessment of the nature and seriousness of the offense and should contain details summarizing the background information of the defendant and the crime.

PRIOR.name: Prior Arrest
PRIOR.description: Information related to previous instances of law enforcement official's apprehension and formal processing of a suspect.

LPROT.name: Protective Order
LPROT.description: Stipulation that certain information that would normally fall under discovery rules will not be disclosed for specifically stated reason.

SP-LPROT.name: Protective Order
SP-LPROT.description: Stipulation that certain information that would normally fall under discovery rules will not be disclosed for specifically stated reason.

LVIC.name: Victim
LVIC.description: Information requiring protection of the name or other details that may identify one who was the victim of a crime.

WIT.name: Witness Protection
WIT.description: Information related to the secretive details associated with one who has testified or may testify under circumstances that require secrecy of that individual and details pertaining to that person.

SP-WIT.name: Witness Protection
SP-WIT.description: Information related to the secretive details associated with one who has testified or may testify under circumstances that require secrecy of that individual and details pertaining to that person.

ARCHR.name: Archaeological Resources
ARCHR.description: Related to information about the nature and location of any archaeological resource for which the excavation or removal requires a permit or other permission.

SP-HISTP.name: Historic Properties
SP-HISTP.description: Related to the location, character, or ownership of historic property.

SP-NPSR.name: National Park System Resources
SP-NPSR.description: Related to information concerning the nature and specific location of a National Park System resource that is endangered, threatened, rare, or commercially valuable, of mineral or paleontological objects within System units, or of objects of cultural patrimony within System units.

NATO-R.name: NATO Restricted
NATO-R.description: Per the United States Security Authority for NATO, Instruction 1-07, information classified as "NATO Restricted", the fourth level of classification under the North Atlantic Treaty, requires safeguards and protection from public release and disclosure. This category does not apply to information classified NATO Confidential, NATO SECRET or NATO COSMIC TOP SECRET.

NATO-U.name: NATO Unclassified
NATO-U.description: Per the United States Security Authority for NATO, Instruction 1-07, this is information classified as "NATO Unclassified", which may only be used for official NATO purposes and may carry administrative or dissemination limitation markings.

NUC.name: General Nuclear
NUC.description: Related to protection of information concerning nuclear reactors, materials, or security.

SP-NUC.name: General Nuclear
SP-NUC.description: Related to protection of information concerning nuclear reactors, materials, or security.

RECCOM.name: Nuclear Recommendation Material
RECCOM.description: Related to recommendations to the Secretary of Energy with respect to Department of Energy defense nuclear facilities as determined necessary to ensure adequate protection of public health and safety.

SP-SRI.name: Nuclear Security-Related Information
SP-SRI.description: Related to information that could be useful, or could reasonably be expected to be useful, to a terrorist in a potential attack that does not qualify as Safeguards or classified information, including the exact location and quantities of radioactive material, certain detailed design drawings, information on nearby facilities, emergency planning information, and certain assessments of vulnerability and safety analyses.

SP-SGI.name: Safeguards Information
SP-SGI.description: Pursuant to 42 USC 2011, et seq., and as defined in 10 CFR 73.2, SGI relates to security related information concerning the physical protection of source, byproduct or special nuclear material and the detailed security measures for facilities and information contained within security plans.

UCNI.name: Unclassified Controlled Nuclear Information - Energy
UCNI.description: Relating to certain design and security information concerning nuclear facilities, materials, and weapons, specific to the Department of Energy.

SP-UCNI.name: Unclassified Controlled Nuclear Information - Energy
SP-UCNI.description: Relating to certain design and security information concerning nuclear facilities, materials, and weapons, specific to the Department of Energy.

APP.name: Patent Applications
APP.description: Application for patent filed under 35 U.S.C. 111(a) that includes all types of patent applications (i.e., utility, design, plant, and reissue) except provisional applications. The nonprovisional application establishes the filing date and initiates the examination process. A nonprovisional utility patent application must include a specification, including a claim or claims; drawings, when necessary; an oath or declaration; and the prescribed filing fee.

INVENT.name: Inventions
INVENT.description: An invention is any art or process (way of doing or making things), machine, manufacture, design, or composition of matter, or any new and useful improvement thereof, or any variety of plant, which is or may be patentable under the patent laws of the United States, in which the federal government owns or may own a right, title, or interest.

PSEC.name: Secrecy Orders
PSEC.description: An order by the Commissioner of Patents that an invention be kept secret and to withhold the publication of an application or the grant of a patent due to national security concerns.

SP-CONTRACT.name: Contract Use
SP-CONTRACT.description: Stipulations for a contractor to meet before material may be used in performance of certain contracts.

DREC.name: Death Records
DREC.description: Related to information contained within an official document issued by a public registry verifying that a person has died, with information such as the date and time of death, the cause of death, and the signature of the attending or examining physician.

PRVCY.name: General Privacy
PRVCY.description: Refers to personal information, or, in some cases, "personally identifiable information," as defined in OMB M-17-12, or "means of identification" as defined in 18 USC 1028(d)(7).

SP-PRVCY.name: General Privacy
SP-PRVCY.description: Refers to personal information, or, in some cases, "personally identifiable information," as defined in OMB M-17-12, or "means of identification" as defined in 18 USC 1028(d)(7).

GENETIC.name: Genetic Information
GENETIC.description: The term "genetic information" means, with respect to any individual, information about-- (i) such individual's genetic tests, (ii) the genetic tests of family members of such individual, and (iii) the manifestation of a disease or disorder in family members of such individual.

SP-GENETIC.name: Genetic Information
SP-GENETIC.description: The term "genetic information" means, with respect to any individual, information about-- (i) such individual's genetic tests, (ii) the genetic tests of family members of such individual, and (iii) the manifestation of a disease or disorder in family members of such individual.

HLTH.name: Health Information
HLTH.description: As per 42 USC 1320d(4), "health information" means any information, whether oral or recorded in any form or medium, that (A) is created or received by a health care provider, health plan, public health authority, employer, life insurer, school or university, or health care clearinghouse; and (B) relates to the past, present, or future physical or mental health or condition of an individual, the provision of health care to an individual, or the past, present, or future payment for the provision of health care to an individual.

SP-HLTH.name: Health Information
SP-HLTH.description: As per 42 USC 1320d(4), "health information" means any information, whether oral or recorded in any form or medium, that (A) is created or received by a health care provider, health plan, public health authority, employer, life insurer, school or university, or health care clearinghouse; and (B) relates to the past, present, or future physical or mental health or condition of an individual, the provision of health care to an individual, or the past, present, or future payment for the provision of health care to an individual.

PRIIG.name: Inspector General Protected
PRIIG.description: Related to the identity of a person making a report to the Inspector General of any Executive agency.

SP-PRIIG.name: Inspector General Protected
SP-PRIIG.description: Related to the identity of a person making a report to the Inspector General of any Executive agency.

MIL.name: Military Personnel Records
MIL.description: Any member or former member of the armed forces or affiliated organization of the Department of Defense.

PERS.name: Personnel Records
PERS.description: Related to the employees of federal agencies.

SP-PERS.name: Personnel Records
SP-PERS.description: Related to the employees of federal agencies.

STUD.name: Student Records
STUD.description: As per 20 USC 1232g, the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act of 1974, an education record which is comprised of those records which are directly related to a student.

SP-STUD.name: Student Records
SP-STUD.description: As per 20 USC 1232g, the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act of 1974, an education record which is comprised of those records which are directly related to a student.

PROCURE.name: General Procurement and Acquisition
PROCURE.description: Material and information relating to, or associated with, the acquisition and procurement of goods and services, including but not limited to, cost or pricing data, contract information, indirect costs and direct labor rates.

SP-PROCURE.name: General Procurement and Acquisition
SP-PROCURE.description: Material and information relating to, or associated with, the acquisition and procurement of goods and services, including but not limited to, cost or pricing data, contract information, indirect costs and direct labor rates.

SBIZ.name: Small Business Research and Technology
SBIZ.description: Relating to certain "Small Business Innovation Research Program" and "Small Business Technology Transfer Program" information in a government database, as referenced in 15 USC 638(k)(2).

SSEL.name: Source Selection
SSEL.description: Per FAR 2.101: any of the following information that is prepared for use by an agency for the purpose of evaluating a bid or proposal to enter into an agency procurement contract, if that information has not been previously made available to the public or disclosed publicly: (Items 1-10).

SP-SSEL.name: Source Selection
SP-SSEL.description: Per FAR 2.101: any of the following information that is prepared for use by an agency for the purpose of evaluating a bid or proposal to enter into an agency procurement contract, if that information has not been previously made available to the public or disclosed publicly: (Items 1-10).

CONREG.name: Entity Registration Information
CONREG.description: Relating to non-public information collected during entity registration in the System for Award Management (SAM), the common source of vendor data for the United States Government.

PROPIN.name: General Proprietary Business Information
PROPIN.description: Material and information relating to, or associated with, a company's products, business, or activities, including but not limited to financial information; data or statements; trade secrets; product research and development; existing and future product designs and performance specifications.

SP-PROPIN.name: General Proprietary Business Information
SP-PROPIN.description: Material and information relating to, or associated with, a company's products, business, or activities, including but not limited to financial information; data or statements; trade secrets; product research and development; existing and future product designs and performance specifications.

OCCMTO.name: Ocean Common Carrier and Marine Terminal Operator Agreements
OCCMTO.description: Relating to agreements between or among ocean common carriers and marine terminal operators as referenced in 46 USC 40301 and 40306.

SERV.name: Ocean Common Carrier Service Contracts
SERV.description: Relating to an agreement for the provision of services filed with the Federal Maritime Commission as referenced in 46 USC 40502(b), 46 CFR 530.4, and/or 46 CFR 531.4(a).

SP-MFC.name: Proprietary Manufacturer
SP-MFC.description: Relating to the production of a consumer product to include that of a private labeler.

POST.name: Proprietary Postal
POST.description: Concerning or related to the course of business of the United States Postal Service.

HSAI.name: Homeland Security Agreement Information
HSAI.description: Information DHS receives and is required to protect pursuant to an agreement with state, local, tribal, territorial, and private sector partners. DHS receives this information in furtherance of the missions of the Department, including but not limited to, support of the Fusion Center Initiative and activities for cyber information sharing consistent with the Cybersecurity Information Security Act.

HSEI.name: Homeland Security Enforcement Information
HSEI.description: Unclassified information of a sensitive nature lawfully created, possessed, or transmitted by DHS in furtherance of its immigration, customs, and other civil and criminal enforcement missions, the unauthorized disclosure of which could adversely impact the mission of the Department.

ISVI-HS.name: Information Systems Vulnerability Information - Homeland
ISVI-HS.description: DHS information technology internal systems data revealing infrastructure used for servers, desktops, and networks; applications name, version and release; switching, router, and gateway information; interconnections and access methods; mission or business use/need. Also includes information regarding developing or current technology, the release of which could hinder the objectives of DHS, compromise a technological advantage or countermeasure, cause a denial of service, or provide an adversary with sufficient information to close, counterfeit, or circumvent a process or system.

INTL-HS.name: International Agreement Information - Homeland
INTL-HS.description: Information DHS receives and is required to protect pursuant to an information sharing agreement or arrangement with a foreign government, an international organization of governments or any element thereof, an international or foreign public or judicial body, or an international or foreign private or non-governmental organization.

OPSEC-PROVISIONAL.name: Operations Security Information
OPSEC-PROVISIONAL.description: Unclassified information that could constitute an indicator of U.S. Government intentions, capabilities, operations, or activities or otherwise threaten/compromise operations security.

PERSEC-HS.name: Personnel Security Information
PERSEC-HS.description: Information that could result in physical risk to DHS personnel or other individuals that DHS is responsible for protecting.

PHYS-HS.name: Physical Security - Homeland
PHYS-HS.description: Assessments or reports illustrating or disclosing facility infrastructure or security vulnerabilities related to the protection of federal buildings, grounds, or property, such as threat assessments, system security plans, contingency plans, risk management plans, business impact analysis studies, and certification and accreditation documentation.

SPII.name: Sensitive Personally Identifiable Information
SPII.description: A subset of PII that, if lost, compromised, or disclosed without authorization could result in substantial harm, embarrassment, inconvenience, or unfairness to an individual. Examples include Social Security Numbers, driver's license numbers, financial account numbers, biometric identifiers, and other sensitive personal data that could cause harm if disclosed.

SURV.name: Investment Survey
SURV.description: Information reported to Treasury, the Federal Reserve Board of Governors, or the Federal Reserve Banks as part of the Treasury International Capital (TIC) data reporting system.

PEST.name: Pesticide Producer Survey
PEST.description: Related to the data gathered regarding the production of pesticides that specifies the non-disclosure of the identity and location of individual producers.

STAT.name: Statistical Information
STAT.description: Refers to information collected by a Federal statistical agency, unit, or program for statistical purposes or used for statistical activities; under law, regulation, or Government-wide policy such 'Statistical' CUI requires: (1) protection from unauthorized disclosure; (2) special handling safeguards; and/or (3) prescribed limits on access or dissemination.

SP-STAT.name: Statistical Information
SP-STAT.description: Refers to information collected by a Federal statistical agency, unit, or program for statistical purposes or used for statistical activities; under law, regulation, or Government-wide policy such 'Statistical' CUI requires: (1) protection from unauthorized disclosure; (2) special handling safeguards; and/or (3) prescribed limits on access or dissemination.

SP-CENS.name: US Census
SP-CENS.description: Related to information gathered by the Bureau of the Census during the process of collecting, compiling, evaluating, analyzing of demographic, economic, and social data pertaining at a specified time to any or all persons in the United States and dissemination is limited to those with special sworn status, who may only use the data for statistical purposes and only for those statistical purposes for which the data was supplied.

SP-TAX.name: Federal Taxpayer Information
SP-TAX.description: Related to returns and return information which are submitted, gathered, or generated in conjunction with taxpayers' responsibilities to comply with federal tax provisions in the United States Code. This includes tax or information returns, declarations of estimated tax, claims for refund, taxpayer's identity, nature/source/amount of income, and information received by the IRS relevant to tax liability determination.

CONV.name: Tax Convention
CONV.description: Related to any--(A) agreement entered into with the competent authority of one or more foreign governments pursuant to a tax convention, (B) application for relief under a tax convention, (C) background information related to such agreement or application, (D) document implementing such agreement, and (E) other information exchanged pursuant to a tax convention which is treated as confidential or secret under the tax convention.

TAI.name: Taxpayer Advocate Information
TAI.description: Information provided by taxpayers to a local taxpayer advocate (LTA) where the LTA has exercised discretion to not disclose to the IRS contact with, or information provided by, a taxpayer. This discretion does not extend to cases where the LTA believes a taxpayer is using the Taxpayer Advocate's office to perpetuate fraud or in cases where the information is sought in litigation.

SP-WDT.name: Written Determinations
SP-WDT.description: Rulings, determination letters, technical advice memoranda or Chief Counsel Advice, as those terms are defined in Treasury Regulation 301.6110-2, which are made available for public inspection subject to the withholding of certain types of data as enumerated in Treasury Regulation 301-6110.

RAIL.name: Railroad Safety Analysis Records
RAIL.description: Related to the establishment, implementation, or modification of a railroad safety risk reduction program or pilot program, if the record is: (1) Supplied to the Secretary (of Transportation) pursuant to that safety risk reduction program or pilot program; or (2) made available for inspection and copying by an officer, employee, or agent of the Secretary pursuant to that safety risk reduction program or pilot program.

SP-SSI.name: Sensitive Security Information
SP-SSI.description: As defined in 49 C.F.R. Part 15.5, Sensitive Security Information is information obtained or developed in the conduct of security activities, including research and development, the disclosure of which DOT has determined would constitute an unwarranted invasion of privacy, reveal trade secrets or confidential information, or be detrimental to transportation safety. As defined in 49 C.F.R. Part 1520.5, Sensitive Security Information is information obtained or developed in the conduct of security activities, including research and development, the disclosure of which DHS/TSA has determined would, among other things, be detrimental to the security of transportation.
